p: A study related to the toxicological extract of the leaves has been carried out in rats by showing LD 50 extract equal to 600â€‰mg/kg bodyweight. The postmortem report shows an alteration in the intestine liver and kidneys, bleeding at subcontracted muscles alongside intestinal tracts, paracentral hepatic necrosis, and tubulin proximal convulsion. However, in the chronic toxicity study, the extract did not show a significant effect in the bodyweight elevation, haematology, its alanine amino serum, the aspartate aminotransferase, and its blood nitrogen urea. This however depends on the dose which affected the histopathological intestine liver and kidneys [ 74].
